page.title: 08BRODICK CASTLE
page.content: Brodick Castle, a seat of the Dukes of Hamilton until 1895, was subsequently the home of Marie Louise, Duchess of Montrose, the only child of the 12th Duke of Hamilton. In 1958, a year after her death, the castle and contents were accepted in lieu of estate duty by the Commissioners of Inland Revenue and the Treasury conveyed them to the National Trust for Scotland.The castle is open to the public every day from Easter until September. In 1984, 55,000 people visited the beautiful rooms built at different times since the castle's origin in the 13th century. These rooms contain many fine examples of silver, porcelain and paintings. The castle has magnificent gardens and 7,300 acres of mountainous territory, the latter the gift of Lady Jean Fford daughter of the Duchess of Hamilton.
